name: Barberry and Orange Tea
description: I have in my pantry a rather large bag of dried barberries, bought at my Persian market, and I had been using them up slowly. Now I know where much of what remains of these sour, zingy vitamin C-rich dried fruits will go.
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, healthy, kosher, low calorie, low-fat, low-sodium, nut-free, vegetarian, fall, winter

recipeInstructions.text: Place the dried barberries in a teapot or pyrex measuring cup. Add the orange zest, orange slices and cloves. Pour on the boiling water. Stir in the honey. Cover and allow the mixture to steep for 15 to 30 minutes. Strain and reheat gently if desired but do not boil.
